refnamediv.refpurpose: File chooser interface used by GtkFileChooserWidget and GtkFileChooserDialog.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Known Implementations
refsect1.para: GtkFileChooser is implemented by GtkFileChooserWidget and GtkFileChooserDialog.

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "action" GtkFileChooserAction : Read / Write "extra-widget" GtkWidget : Read / Write "file-system-backend" gchararray : Write / Construct Only "filter" GtkFileFilter : Read / Write "local-only" gboolean : Read / Write "preview-widget" GtkWidget : Read / Write "preview-widget-active" gboolean : Read / Write "select-multiple" gboolean : Read / Write "show-hidden" gboolean : Read / Write "use-preview-label" gboolean : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
Description
refsect1.para: GtkFileChooser is an interface that can be implemented by file selection widgets. In GTK+, the main objects that implement this interface are GtkFileChooserWidget and GtkFileChooserDialog. You do not need to write an object that implements the GtkFileChooser interface unless you are trying to adapt an existing file selector to expose a standard programming interface.

refsect2.title: Adding a Preview Widget
refsect2.para: You can add a custom preview widget to a file chooser and then get notification about when the preview needs to be updated. To install a preview widget, use gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget(). Then, connect to the GtkFileChooser::update-preview signal to get notified when you need to update the contents of the preview.

Your callback should use gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_filename() to see what needs previewing. Once you have generated the preview for the corresponding file, you must call gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active() with a boolean flag that indicates whether your callback could successfully generate a preview.

example.title: Sample Usage

refsect2.title: Adding Extra Widgets
refsect2.para: You can add extra widgets to a file chooser to provide options that are not present in the default design. For example, you can add a toggle button to give the user the option to open a file in read-only mode. You can use gtk_file_chooser_set_extra_widget() to insert additional widgets in a file chooser.

example.title: Sample Usage

note.para: If you want to set more than one extra widget in the file chooser, you can a container such as a GtkVBox or a GtkTable and include your widgets in it. Then, set the container as the whole extra widget.

refsect2.title: enum GtkFileChooserAction
refsect2.para: Describes whether a GtkFileChooser is being used to open existing files or to save to a possibly new file.

listitem.simpara: Indicates open mode. The file chooser will only let the user pick an existing file.
Indicates save mode. The file chooser will let the user pick an existing file, or type in a new filename.
Indicates an Open mode for selecting folders. The file chooser will let the user pick an existing folder.
Indicates a mode for creating a new folder. The file chooser will let the user name an existing or new folder.

refsect2.title: GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ERROR
refsect2.para: Used to get the GError quark for GtkFileChooser errors.

refsect2.title: enum GtkFileChooserError
refsect2.para: These identify the various errors that can occur while calling GtkFileChooser functions.

listitem.simpara: Indicates that a file does not exist.
Indicates a malformed filename.

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_error_quark ()
refsect2.para: Registers an error quark for GtkFileChooser if necessary.

listitem.simpara: The error quark used for GtkFileChooser errors.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_action ()
refsect2.para: Sets the type of operation that that the chooser is performing; the user interface is adapted to suit the selected action. For example, an option to create a new folder might be shown if the action is GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE but not if the action is GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the action that the file selector is performing

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_action ()
refsect2.para: Gets the type of operation that the file chooser is performing; see gtk_file_chooser_set_action().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the action that the file selector is performing

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_local_only ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether only local files can be selected in the file selector. If local_only is TRUE (the default), then the selected file are files are guaranteed to be accessible through the operating systems native file file system and therefore the application only needs to worry about the filename functions in GtkFileChooser, like gtk_file_chooser_get_filename(), rather than the URI functions like gtk_file_chooser_get_uri(),

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
TRUE if only local files can be selected

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_local_only ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether only local files can be selected in the file selector. See gtk_file_chooser_set_local_only()

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChoosre
TRUE if only local files can be selected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_select_multiple ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether multiple files can be selected in the file selector. This is only relevant if the action is set to be GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN or GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE. It cannot be set with either of the folder actions.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_select_multiple ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether multiple files can be selected in the file selector. See gtk_file_chooser_set_select_multiple().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current name in the file selector, as if entered by the user. Note that the name passed in here is a UTF-8 string rather than a filename. This function is meant for such uses as a suggested name in a "Save As..." dialog.
If you want to preselect a particular existing file, you should use gtk_file_chooser_set_filename() instead.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the filename to use, as a UTF-8 string

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_filename ()
refsect2.para: Gets the filename for the currently selected file in the file selector. If multiple files are selected, one of the filenames will be returned at random.
If the file chooser is in folder mode, this function returns the selected folder.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
The currently selected filename, or NULL if no file is selected, or the selected file can't be represented with a local filename. Free with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_filename ()
refsect2.para: Sets filename as the current filename for the the file chooser; If the file name isn't in the current folder of chooser, then the current folder of chooser will be changed to the folder containing filename. This is equivalent to a sequence of gtk_file_chooser_unselect_all() followed by gtk_file_chooser_select_filename().
Note that the file must exist, or nothing will be done except for the directory change. To pre-enter a filename for the user, as in a save-as dialog, use gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name()

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the filename to set as current
TRUE if both the folder could be changed and the file was selected successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_select_filename ()
refsect2.para: Selects a filename. If the file name isn't in the current folder of chooser, then the current folder of chooser will be changed to the folder containing filename.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the filename to select
TRUE if both the folder could be changed and the file was selected successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_unselect_filename ()
refsect2.para: Unselects a currently selected filename. If the filename is not in the current directory, does not exist, or is otherwise not currently selected, does nothing.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the filename to unselect

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_select_all ()
refsect2.para: Selects all the files in the current folder of a file chooser.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_unselect_all ()
refsect2.para: Unselects all the files in the current folder of a file chooser.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_filenames ()
refsect2.para: Lists all the selected files and subfolders in the current folder of chooser. The returned names are full absolute paths. If files in the current folder cannot be represented as local filenames they will be ignored. (See gtk_file_chooser_get_uris())

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
a GSList containing the filenames of all selected files and subfolders in the current folder. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the filenames with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current folder for chooser from a local filename. The user will be shown the full contents of the current folder, plus user interface elements for navigating to other folders.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the full path of the new current folder
TRUE if the folder could be changed successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current folder of chooser as a local filename. See gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the full path of the current folder, or NULL if the current path cannot be represented as a local filename. Free with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_uri ()
refsect2.para: Gets the URI for the currently selected file in the file selector. If multiple files are selected, one of the filenames will be returned at random.
If the file chooser is in folder mode, this function returns the selected folder.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
The currently selected URI, or NULL if no file is selected. Free with g_free()

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_uri ()
refsect2.para: Sets the file referred to by uri as the current file for the the file chooser; If the file name isn't in the current folder of chooser, then the current folder of chooser will be changed to the folder containing uri. This is equivalent to a sequence of gtk_file_chooser_unselect_all() followed by gtk_file_chooser_select_uri().
Note that the file must exist, or nothing will be done except for the directory change. To pre-enter a filename for the user, as in a save-as dialog, use gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name()

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the URI to set as current
TRUE if both the folder could be changed and the URI was selected successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_select_uri ()
refsect2.para: Selects the file to by uri. If the URI doesn't refer to a file in the current folder of chooser, then the current folder of chooser will be changed to the folder containing filename.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the URI to select
TRUE if both the folder could be changed and the URI was selected successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_unselect_uri ()
refsect2.para: Unselects the file referred to by uri. If the file is not in the current directory, does not exist, or is otherwise not currently selected, does nothing.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the URI to unselect

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_uris ()
refsect2.para: Lists all the selected files and subfolders in the current folder of chooser. The returned names are full absolute URIs.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
a GSList containing the URIs of all selected files and subfolders in the current folder. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the filenames with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_uri ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current folder for chooser from an URI. The user will be shown the full contents of the current folder, plus user interface elements for navigating to other folders.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the URI for the new current folder
TRUE if the folder could be changed successfully, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder_uri ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current folder of chooser as an URI. See gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_uri().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the URI for the current folder. Free with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget ()
refsect2.para: Sets an application-supplied widget to use to display a custom preview of the currently selected file. To implement a preview, after setting the preview widget, you connect to the ::selection-changed signal, and call gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_filename() or gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_uri() on each change. If you can display a preview of the new file, update your widget and set the preview active using gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active(). Otherwise, set the preview inactive.

When there is no application-supplied preview widget, or the application-supplied preview widget is not active, the file chooser may display an internally generated preview of the current file or it may display no preview at all.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
widget for displaying preview.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_widget ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current preview widget; see gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the current preview widget, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the preview widget set by gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active() should be shown for the current filename. When active is set to false, the file chooser may display an internally generated preview of the current file or it may display no preview at all. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget() for more details.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
whether to display the user-specified preview widget

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_widget_active ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether the preview widget set by gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget() should be shown for the current filename. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
TRUE if the preview widget is active for the current filename.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_use_preview_label ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the file chooser should display a stock label with the name of the file that is being previewed; the default is TRUE. Applications that want to draw the whole preview area themselves should set this to FALSE and display the name themselves in their preview widget.
See also: gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget()

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
whether to display a stock label with the name of the previewed file

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_use_preview_label ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether a stock label should be drawn with the name of the previewed file. See gtk_file_chooser_set_use_preview_label().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
TRUE if the file chooser is set to display a label with the name of the previewed file, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_filename ()
refsect2.para: Gets the filename that should be previewed in a custom preview widget. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the filename to preview, or NULL if no file is selected, or if the selected file cannot be represented as a local filename. Free with g_free()

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_uri ()
refsect2.para: Gets the URI that should be previewed in a custom preview widget. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the URI for the file to preview, or NULL if no file is selected. Free with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_extra_widget ()
refsect2.para: Sets an application-supplied widget to provide extra options to the user.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
widget for extra options

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_extra_widget ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current preview widget; see gtk_file_chooser_set_extra_widget().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the current extra widget, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_add_filter ()
refsect2.para: Adds filter to the list of filters that the user can select between. When a filter is selected, only files that are passed by that filter are displayed.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
a GtkFileFilter

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_remove_filter ()
refsect2.para: Removes filter from the list of filters that the user can select between.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
a GtkFileFilter

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_list_filters ()
refsect2.para: Lists the current set of user-selectable filters; see gtk_file_chooser_add_filter(), gtk_file_chooser_remove_filter().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
a GSList containing the current set of user selectable filters. The contents of the list are owned by GTK+, but you must free the list itself with g_slist_free() when you are done with it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_set_filter ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current filter; only the files that pass the filter will be displayed. If the user-selectable list of filters is non-empty, then the filter should be one of the filters in that list. Setting the current filter when the list of filters is empty is useful if you want to restrict the displayed set of files without letting the user change it.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
a GtkFileFilter

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_get_filter ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current filter; see gtk_file_chooser_set_filter().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
the current filter, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder ()
refsect2.para: Adds a folder to be displayed with the shortcut folders in a file chooser. Note that shortcut folders do not get saved, as they are provided by the application. For example, you can use this to add a "/usr/share/mydrawprogram/Clipart" folder to the volume list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
filename of the folder to add
location to store error, or NULL
TRUE if the folder could be added successfully, FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the error will be set as appropriate.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_remove_shortcut_folder ()
refsect2.para: Removes a folder from a file chooser's list of shortcut folders.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
filename of the folder to remove
location to store error, or NULL

TRUE if the operation succeeds, FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the error will be set as appropriate.
See also: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder()

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_list_shortcut_folders ()
refsect2.para: Queries the list of shortcut folders in the file chooser, as set by gtk_file_chooser_set_shortcut_folders().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
A list of folder filenames, or NULL if there are no shortcut folders. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the filenames with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder_uri ()
refsect2.para: Adds a folder URI to be displayed with the shortcut folders in a file chooser. Note that shortcut folders do not get saved, as they are provided by the application. For example, you can use this to add a "file:///usr/share/mydrawprogram/Clipart" folder to the volume list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
URI of the folder to add
location to store error, or NULL
TRUE if the folder could be added successfully, FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the error will be set as appropriate.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_remove_shortcut_folder_uri ()
refsect2.para: Removes a folder URI from a file chooser's list of shortcut folders.

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
URI of the folder to remove
location to store error, or NULL

TRUE if the operation succeeds, FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the error will be set as appropriate.
See also: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder_uri()

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_file_chooser_list_shortcut_folder_uris ()
refsect2.para: Queries the list of shortcut folders in the file chooser, as set by gtk_file_chooser_set_shortcut_folder_uris().

listitem.simpara: a GtkFileChooser
A list of folder URIs, or NULL if there are no shortcut folders. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the URIs with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

listitem.para: The type of operation that the file selector is performing.
Application supplied widget for extra options.
Name of file system backend to use.
The current filter for selecting which files are displayed.
Whether the selected file(s) should be limited to local file: URLs.
Application supplied widget for custom previews.
Whether the application supplied widget for custom previews should be shown.
Whether to allow multiple files to be selected.
Whether the hidden files and folders should be displayed.
Whether to display a stock label with the name of the previewed file.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
